channel.title: Getting on ma server
channel.description:
Well i have a problem. Whenever someone logs on my server. they get this message: No response from server, try a different world. When i tryied logging in this came up in runserver.bat
[code] ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:1085 Exception in thread "Thread-0" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 800 at Player.<init>(Player.java:47) at client.<init>(client.java:8463) at PlayerHandler.newPlayerClient(PlayerHandler.java:44) at server.run(server.java:148) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code] ( thats Me trying to log in :S ) Also could you try fix Item is static?[br][size=1]Posted at: December 14, 2006, 02:15:56 PM[/size][hr]Well im going to skool, hpefully some nice guy will help :D[br][size=1]Posted at: December 14, 2006, 02:19:51 PM[/size][hr]Plz :D

item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Mrquarter:

That is just one reason. What I said is what happened to me and my friends and it fixed when I told them.

Nah. You just don’t understand errors.

By the way, this is what I was talking about earlier:

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

item.title: Getting on ma server
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Mrquarter:

That happens to everybody. It means a code is out of bounds (wrong spot). Try moving the code you just recently added.

Retard, it means that he tried to access a location in an array which he didn’t allocate.

Say you have an int[20];
You may only access index ranging from 0 to 19. Sometime during the login process, in Player.java, you had something try to go into the index 800, which you didn’t allocate.

Read full topic
